gurmukhi: bhuqu kwl muMCq BeI Kylq hir ky swQ ]muMCq h√çY iqn XO lKXo hir Awey Ab hwQ ]2476]
transliteration: Bahout(u) Kaal Mounndhhat Bhaikhelat Har(i) Ke Saath|| Mounndhhat Hvai Tin Yau Lakhyo Har(i) Aae Ab Haath||2476||
translation: Playing with Krishna for a long time, they became unconscious and in that unconscious state they saw that they had got Krishna in their grip.2476.

gurmukhi: hirjn hir sMg imlq hY sunq pRym kI gwQ ]ijau fwirE imil jwq hY nIr nIr ky swQ ]2477]
transliteration: Harijan Har(i) San Milat Hai Sounat Prem Kigadth|| Jio Daario Mil(i) Jaat Hai Neer Neer Ke Saath||2477||
translation: The devotees of the Lord. listening to the discourse of love from the Lord, become one with him like the water being mixed with water.2477.

gurmukhi: jl qy qb hir bwhir Awey ]AMgh suMdr bsqR bnwey ]kw aupmw iqh kI kib khY ]pyKq mYn rIJ kY rhY ]2478]
transliteration: Jal Te Tab Har(i) Baahar(i) Aae|| Anad Soundar Bastra Banaae|| Kaa Oupmaa Tih Kikabi Kahai|| Pekhat Main Reejh Kai Rahai||2478||
translation: Then Krishna came out of water and he wore beautiful clothes; how should the poet describe his glory? Seeing him even the god of love is fascinated by him.2478.

gurmukhi: bsqR qRIAn hUM suMdr Dry ]dwn bhuq ibpRn kau kry ]ijh iqh TwN hir ko gun gwXo ]iqh dwrd Dn dyie gvwXo ]2479]
transliteration: Bastra Treean Hoon Soundar Ddare|| Daan Bahout Bipran Kau Dare|| Jih Tih Thaandhar(i) Ko Goun Gadyo|| Tih Daarad Dhan De(i) Gadaayo||2479||
translation: The women also wore beautiful garments and gave a great deal of charity to the Brahmins; whosoever eulogised the Lord there, they gave him there a good amount of wealth and removed his poverty.2479.
Now beings the description of the episode of love

gurmukhi: hir ky sMqk bFI sunwaU ]qw qy pRB logn irJvwaU ]jo ieh kQw qnk sun pwvY ]qw ky doK dUr hoie jwvY ]2480]
transliteration: Har(i) Ke Santak Badhisounaaoo|| Taa Te Prabh Logad Rijhvaaoo|| Jo Eh Kathaa Tanak Soun Paavai|| Taa Ke Dokh Door Hoe Jaavai||2480||
translation: I relate the praise of the devotees of the Lord and please the saints; he, who will listen to this episode slightly, all his blemishes will be removed.2480.

gurmukhi: jYsy qiRnwvRq Aau AG ko su bkwsur ko bD jw muK PwirE ]KMf kIE sktwsur ko gh kysn qy ijh kMs pCwirE ]
transliteration: Jaise Trinaavrat Au Agh Ko Su Bakaasur Ko Badh Jaa Moukh Phaario|| Khanndkeeo Saktaasur Ko Gad Kesan Te Jih Kans Pachhaadio||
translation: The way in which Tranavrata, Aghasura and Bakasura were killed and their faces were torn; the way in which chopping Shaktasura into bits and Kansa was caught and knocked down by catching him from his hair;

gurmukhi: isMDjrw hUM ko sYn miQE Aru S`qHu ko ijh mwnih twirE ]iqau biRjnwiek sw Dn ky pun cwhn hY sB pwpn twirE ]2481]
transliteration: Sindhjaraa Hoon Ko Sain Mathio Ar(u) Shattrahu Ko Jih Maanah(i) Taario|| Tio Brijnaaik Saa Dhan Ke Poun Chaahat Hai Sabh Paapan Taarrio||2481||
translation: The way in which the army of Jarasandh was churned and his pride was shattered, in the same way, Krishna wants to finish all the sins of those women.2481.
